text: Adam Kerinaiua (born 17 June 1974) is a former Australian rules footballer who played with the Brisbane Bears in the Australian Football League (AFL). Kerinaiua, a Tiwi Islander, was recruited from North Darwin in the Northern Territory Football League (NTFL). He played three of the final four rounds of the 1992 AFL season, aged just 18.AFL Tables: Adam Kerinaiua In all three games he didn't find much of the ball but kicked a goal against Geelong. He was a member of the Indigenous All-Stars team which defeated Collingwood in an exhibition match in 1994. ==References== ==External links== * * Category:1974 births Category:Indigenous Australian players of Australian rules football Category:Australian rules footballers from the Northern Territory Category:Brisbane Bears players Category:Palmerston Football Club players Category:Living people Category:Tiwi Islands people Category:St Mary's Football Club (NTFL) players
title: Adam Kerinaiua
